place.name: BROMSBERROW
place.gazetteerText: BROMSBORROW, a parish in Newent district, Gloucester; on the verge of the county, 4 miles SE of Ledbury r. station. Post Town, Ledbury. Acres, 1,803. Real property, £3,206. Pop., 305. Houses, 51. The property is divided among a few. Bromsborrow Place belonged to the Yateses, and passed to the Ricardos. Bromsborrow Heath is a meet for the Ledbury hounds. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. Value, £339.* Patron, Earl Beauchamp. The church is ancient and excellent; and has monuments of the Yateses. Charities, £5. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
